humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathology report provides the maximum diameter of the tumor, which is 5.5 cm. According to the rules provided, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby structures. In this report, the diagnosis is invasive ductal breast carcinoma with a maximum diameter of 5.5 cm. The tumor classification is pT3, which corresponds to a tumor size of more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient is T3.
